comment: I am a full supporter and fan of Johnny and Amber Heard is a liar!
commentable_entity.ask: Support Fantastic Beasts--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.title: Kate Quinn:  Support JK Rowling's Fantastic Beasts Sequel--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.description:
Johnny Depp was accused of something he did not do. He may not have done any prison time, but he may as well be a prisoner of the label inflicted upon him. "Domestic Abuser," is what blindsided Harry Potter fans on Twitter called him as soon as they learned Depp was cast in the saga of JK Rowling's "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them."  Those outraged by the idea of Johnny Depp having anything to do with Harry Potter, a story that promotes anti-bullying and awareness of domestic violence towards children, etc...they NEED to know that this man is INNOCENT. Johnny Depp knew, like so many others, that the West Memphis Three were innocent. He campaigned passionately for them along with Patti Smith, Eddie Vedder and others. However, even after all was said and done, the Three were released from prison, ONLY if they pleaded guilty to murders they never committed! Now, they will wear that stigma on their characters for years, unless they can somehow re-open the case and prove themselves innocent.

Amber Heard was arrested for hitting Tasya Van Ree in 2009, and even if Tasya, obviously still a victim in denial, declared homophobia to be the reason for the arrest?  Beverly Ellis, the very officer who made the arrest, revealed herself and shot back at Tasya's claims.  Ellis is an openly gay woman.  

Domestic Violence against women is too strong an issue to just blindly look at the surface and run on emotions alone. There are many facets to Domestic Violence.  Women are not the only victims of it.  Children, obviously, and even men, are often victims as well.  How many obvious signs that Amber Heard lied about her husband's "violence" were ignored?  Probably more signs than there are letters in the alphabet.  The four that stand out in my mind, however, are as follows:

  1. Those people who SAW, with their own eyes that Amber was NOT bruised the night of, and after May 21st, i.e. Johnny's bodyguards and the concierge at the L.A. Condominium.
  2. The picture of a perfectly bruise-free Amber on Instagram, taken that very next day, Sunday, May 22nd that was suddenly, mysteriously deleted before the abuse claims became headline news.
  3. Vanessa Paradis, a MOM, supposedly dumped by Depp FOR Heard, supporting the father of her kids.  What mom in her right mind would not have had full custody of those two teens had Johnny indeed been beating Amber all through their relationship?  And don't tell me she wouldn't have known...Johnny stays close with his family, and that includes the mother of his kids.
  4. Most Important: The LAPD.  The police, especially in L.A. are NOT allowed to turn a blind eye to a woman claiming abuse by her husband.  Even if said woman didn't file a report.  Why was Johnny Depp not arrested?  Simple.  Not only did the police see no evidence of violence or disarray in the room("No evidence of a crime") but they also stated that Amber never mentioned violence.,


It's a terrible, distasteful slur on humanity that feminism has become so dogmatic that anyone who looked closely at both sides of Amber Heard's story were mocked, shunned, and many times cyberbullied in horrible ways.  Lily Rose Depp endured many horrible words on one of her posts on Instagram.  One highly emotional and angry woman actually stated that Lily Rose should never have been born!  A woman, angry about another woman's alleged, but not PROVEN, abuse, shot back by emotionally abusing ANOTHER woman--a young one at that!  This hypocrisy is the result of leaning too much on emotion and personal experience, rather than facts.    Amber Heard has an arrest record of Domestic Violence--Johnny Depp doesn't even have a history of it.  Johnny Depp has a history of hitting furniture, throwing bottles, whatnot, trashing hotel rooms, but those things are inanimate objects.  He never once hit a woman in the history of his career or we would have heard about it, and he would have owned up and gone for help.  I forgot one more telltale sign. Why did Johnny Depp refuse Amber instant spousal support if he physically abused her the whole time they were together? He'd have given half his fortune in a heartbeat if any of her claims had been true. 

As hard as it is for many to accept, being that she's a woman, the truth is that Amber Heard has insulted the cause of Stopping Domestic Violence Against Women.  She did so by accusing an innocent man of hurting her physically, when it's crystal clear Johnny Depp did no such thing.  The signs are all there.  Heard may or may not have done it for money but she certainly did it spitefully--obviously because their relationship was toxic from go.  Amber clearly is a sick, sad person who could benefit from professional help--but she doesn't seem to be seeking any.  However--we cannot let her lies OR her myopic supporters affect Johnny doing his job, when he does it so beautifully!

Johnny Depp had to have gone through intense agony this past summer, although he hid it well with a brave face. It may not be desirable to him to re-open the case and prove Amber Heard a liar, given the stress it would bring about for him and his family. However, let's not forget that Depp was prepared with 23 witnesses for the upcoming trial in August.  

Of course, Amber Heard is a master at what she set out to do to him. She, having lived with and known him for four years, knew how to push Johnny Depp's buttons. It was malicious. Once Amber learned of all the ammunition Johnny had gathered for his defense, she wasted no time putting out that video of Johnny cursing and banging around inanimate objects while drunk. She denied putting the video out, but that was just a cover up. No one who saw that video didn't cringe when they saw Johnny Depp really angry--for real, not playing a character. Those who supported Amber took that video and assumed the worst. However, they failed to notice many things.  For one, the camera filming the video was BEHIND Amber Heard, not held in her hand. Why else would we see her? What we hear at the end of the video which may sound like a scuffle and perhaps Amber being thrown to the floor--is actually Johnny ripping the hidden camera out of the wall. What else would it be? He gestures to Amber's hand holding the remote to the camera. But he did not grab the remote. He went right for the camera.  Also, Johnny believed he was by himself before Amber showed up, asking "What happened?" and so on.  Angry as Johnny was, he never verbally abused or degraded Heard, calling her horrific names and slandering her character. His only action was to reach for the remote control in her hand...and then make a bee line for the camera to dismantle it. 

The final straw for Depp was the picture of the severed finger, and the message he "supposedly" wrote on a mirror that indicated Amber Heard had been unfaithful to Johnny with Billy Bob Thornton.

NOBODY took into consideration that despite the report of "Johnny's dipping his gushing finger in paint"...that mirror would be spattered with blood and the message would never have been legible. Why didn't anyone consider that?

Whoever painted that horrible message about Amber Heard and Billy Bob Thornton on that mirror--was not someone with a severed finger gushing blood.  Johnny Depp never painted that message.  That is clear evidence that again, was overlooked by supporters of Amber Heard.

The horrific anguish which I have been through myself, that women have suffered in domestically violent relationships with men, again, caused emotions to run high when Depp was accused. Emotions alone and not sense ruled those supporting Amber in the social media trial. As emotional as I got, however,I also made sure to look carefully at all the clear evidence on both sides. Once I learned what was really going on, I, yes, joined the fray and went to town on social media.  I defended Johnny like a raging lion and still do.  But we will not bring Johnny Depp peace by fighting and mud-slinging with each other.

We need to show support and promote awareness of Domestic Violence against ALL humans. We need to NOT lessen the importance of stopping REAL Abuse Against Women--but we can't forget that all men are not perpetrators and misogynists. Johnny Depp isn't just one more "white male celebrity who can get away with hitting his wife and still work." This is not about that. Johnny Depp is INNOCENT. Mel Gibson and other male celebrities who were proven guilty, yes, may not have much trouble getting work. It's a sad state of affairs, yes, and I am not denying that sexism and misogyny are alive and well in Hollywood. However?  Once all aspects are studied carefully and looked at with at least one foot in logic, not emotion, we CAN see that Johnny Depp was framed.  That said?  We cannot afford to allow Depp to be lumped in with those who actually DID hurt their girlfriends/wives.  That does not help women who suffer violence in the home, any more than allowing these other GUILTY celebrities to continue to work in Hollywood does.

Let's stand strong against violence, lies, bullying and ALL forms of abuse! Let's remember that not ALL celebrity men are conceited misogynists who don't care about anybody but themselves. Johnny Depp has always been real, upfront and has always spoken his Truth. Everyone who meets him or watches an interview with him knows how GENUINELY kind and good he truly is. It's not an act. No one who works with Johnny doesn't know that, no one who loves him doesn't know that.  

Stereotypes, Blindsidedness, bias towards ONE gender who gets domestically violated, stops here.  The unfairly boycotted "Alice: Through the Looking Glass" has a powerful message about how we handle time. Time gives before it takes. Let's use Time as a gift to help end blind fear, needless boycotting, bullying and hate!  LOVE is what keeps Johnny Depp going, as the video above relays.   Johnny was also honored with the Healing and Hope award by Rhonda's Kiss  for his work to find a cure for cancer.  His beloved mother, Betty Sue, died of cancer on May 20th. Here also is a video montage of Johnny discussing what his two children, Lily Rose and Jack, mean to him.  Lily Rose had E-Coli in 2007 and made it through, as Johnny also mentions in his Rhonda's Kiss acceptance speech.

Johnny Depp Talking About His Kids!

Thank you ALL again, for standing up for pure, unconditional Love--and Innocence!

comment: I believe Heard's allegations are completely false and Johnny Depp's career and reputation should not be stained by it
commentable_entity.ask: Support Fantastic Beasts--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.title: Kate Quinn:  Support JK Rowling's Fantastic Beasts Sequel--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.description:
Johnny Depp was accused of something he did not do. He may not have done any prison time, but he may as well be a prisoner of the label inflicted upon him. "Domestic Abuser," is what blindsided Harry Potter fans on Twitter called him as soon as they learned Depp was cast in the saga of JK Rowling's "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them."  Those outraged by the idea of Johnny Depp having anything to do with Harry Potter, a story that promotes anti-bullying and awareness of domestic violence towards children, etc...they NEED to know that this man is INNOCENT. Johnny Depp knew, like so many others, that the West Memphis Three were innocent. He campaigned passionately for them along with Patti Smith, Eddie Vedder and others. However, even after all was said and done, the Three were released from prison, ONLY if they pleaded guilty to murders they never committed! Now, they will wear that stigma on their characters for years, unless they can somehow re-open the case and prove themselves innocent.

Amber Heard was arrested for hitting Tasya Van Ree in 2009, and even if Tasya, obviously still a victim in denial, declared homophobia to be the reason for the arrest?  Beverly Ellis, the very officer who made the arrest, revealed herself and shot back at Tasya's claims.  Ellis is an openly gay woman.  

Domestic Violence against women is too strong an issue to just blindly look at the surface and run on emotions alone. There are many facets to Domestic Violence.  Women are not the only victims of it.  Children, obviously, and even men, are often victims as well.  How many obvious signs that Amber Heard lied about her husband's "violence" were ignored?  Probably more signs than there are letters in the alphabet.  The four that stand out in my mind, however, are as follows:

  1. Those people who SAW, with their own eyes that Amber was NOT bruised the night of, and after May 21st, i.e. Johnny's bodyguards and the concierge at the L.A. Condominium.
  2. The picture of a perfectly bruise-free Amber on Instagram, taken that very next day, Sunday, May 22nd that was suddenly, mysteriously deleted before the abuse claims became headline news.
  3. Vanessa Paradis, a MOM, supposedly dumped by Depp FOR Heard, supporting the father of her kids.  What mom in her right mind would not have had full custody of those two teens had Johnny indeed been beating Amber all through their relationship?  And don't tell me she wouldn't have known...Johnny stays close with his family, and that includes the mother of his kids.
  4. Most Important: The LAPD.  The police, especially in L.A. are NOT allowed to turn a blind eye to a woman claiming abuse by her husband.  Even if said woman didn't file a report.  Why was Johnny Depp not arrested?  Simple.  Not only did the police see no evidence of violence or disarray in the room("No evidence of a crime") but they also stated that Amber never mentioned violence.,


It's a terrible, distasteful slur on humanity that feminism has become so dogmatic that anyone who looked closely at both sides of Amber Heard's story were mocked, shunned, and many times cyberbullied in horrible ways.  Lily Rose Depp endured many horrible words on one of her posts on Instagram.  One highly emotional and angry woman actually stated that Lily Rose should never have been born!  A woman, angry about another woman's alleged, but not PROVEN, abuse, shot back by emotionally abusing ANOTHER woman--a young one at that!  This hypocrisy is the result of leaning too much on emotion and personal experience, rather than facts.    Amber Heard has an arrest record of Domestic Violence--Johnny Depp doesn't even have a history of it.  Johnny Depp has a history of hitting furniture, throwing bottles, whatnot, trashing hotel rooms, but those things are inanimate objects.  He never once hit a woman in the history of his career or we would have heard about it, and he would have owned up and gone for help.  I forgot one more telltale sign. Why did Johnny Depp refuse Amber instant spousal support if he physically abused her the whole time they were together? He'd have given half his fortune in a heartbeat if any of her claims had been true. 

As hard as it is for many to accept, being that she's a woman, the truth is that Amber Heard has insulted the cause of Stopping Domestic Violence Against Women.  She did so by accusing an innocent man of hurting her physically, when it's crystal clear Johnny Depp did no such thing.  The signs are all there.  Heard may or may not have done it for money but she certainly did it spitefully--obviously because their relationship was toxic from go.  Amber clearly is a sick, sad person who could benefit from professional help--but she doesn't seem to be seeking any.  However--we cannot let her lies OR her myopic supporters affect Johnny doing his job, when he does it so beautifully!

Johnny Depp had to have gone through intense agony this past summer, although he hid it well with a brave face. It may not be desirable to him to re-open the case and prove Amber Heard a liar, given the stress it would bring about for him and his family. However, let's not forget that Depp was prepared with 23 witnesses for the upcoming trial in August.  

Of course, Amber Heard is a master at what she set out to do to him. She, having lived with and known him for four years, knew how to push Johnny Depp's buttons. It was malicious. Once Amber learned of all the ammunition Johnny had gathered for his defense, she wasted no time putting out that video of Johnny cursing and banging around inanimate objects while drunk. She denied putting the video out, but that was just a cover up. No one who saw that video didn't cringe when they saw Johnny Depp really angry--for real, not playing a character. Those who supported Amber took that video and assumed the worst. However, they failed to notice many things.  For one, the camera filming the video was BEHIND Amber Heard, not held in her hand. Why else would we see her? What we hear at the end of the video which may sound like a scuffle and perhaps Amber being thrown to the floor--is actually Johnny ripping the hidden camera out of the wall. What else would it be? He gestures to Amber's hand holding the remote to the camera. But he did not grab the remote. He went right for the camera.  Also, Johnny believed he was by himself before Amber showed up, asking "What happened?" and so on.  Angry as Johnny was, he never verbally abused or degraded Heard, calling her horrific names and slandering her character. His only action was to reach for the remote control in her hand...and then make a bee line for the camera to dismantle it. 

The final straw for Depp was the picture of the severed finger, and the message he "supposedly" wrote on a mirror that indicated Amber Heard had been unfaithful to Johnny with Billy Bob Thornton.

NOBODY took into consideration that despite the report of "Johnny's dipping his gushing finger in paint"...that mirror would be spattered with blood and the message would never have been legible. Why didn't anyone consider that?

Whoever painted that horrible message about Amber Heard and Billy Bob Thornton on that mirror--was not someone with a severed finger gushing blood.  Johnny Depp never painted that message.  That is clear evidence that again, was overlooked by supporters of Amber Heard.

The horrific anguish which I have been through myself, that women have suffered in domestically violent relationships with men, again, caused emotions to run high when Depp was accused. Emotions alone and not sense ruled those supporting Amber in the social media trial. As emotional as I got, however,I also made sure to look carefully at all the clear evidence on both sides. Once I learned what was really going on, I, yes, joined the fray and went to town on social media.  I defended Johnny like a raging lion and still do.  But we will not bring Johnny Depp peace by fighting and mud-slinging with each other.

We need to show support and promote awareness of Domestic Violence against ALL humans. We need to NOT lessen the importance of stopping REAL Abuse Against Women--but we can't forget that all men are not perpetrators and misogynists. Johnny Depp isn't just one more "white male celebrity who can get away with hitting his wife and still work." This is not about that. Johnny Depp is INNOCENT. Mel Gibson and other male celebrities who were proven guilty, yes, may not have much trouble getting work. It's a sad state of affairs, yes, and I am not denying that sexism and misogyny are alive and well in Hollywood. However?  Once all aspects are studied carefully and looked at with at least one foot in logic, not emotion, we CAN see that Johnny Depp was framed.  That said?  We cannot afford to allow Depp to be lumped in with those who actually DID hurt their girlfriends/wives.  That does not help women who suffer violence in the home, any more than allowing these other GUILTY celebrities to continue to work in Hollywood does.

Let's stand strong against violence, lies, bullying and ALL forms of abuse! Let's remember that not ALL celebrity men are conceited misogynists who don't care about anybody but themselves. Johnny Depp has always been real, upfront and has always spoken his Truth. Everyone who meets him or watches an interview with him knows how GENUINELY kind and good he truly is. It's not an act. No one who works with Johnny doesn't know that, no one who loves him doesn't know that.  

Stereotypes, Blindsidedness, bias towards ONE gender who gets domestically violated, stops here.  The unfairly boycotted "Alice: Through the Looking Glass" has a powerful message about how we handle time. Time gives before it takes. Let's use Time as a gift to help end blind fear, needless boycotting, bullying and hate!  LOVE is what keeps Johnny Depp going, as the video above relays.   Johnny was also honored with the Healing and Hope award by Rhonda's Kiss  for his work to find a cure for cancer.  His beloved mother, Betty Sue, died of cancer on May 20th. Here also is a video montage of Johnny discussing what his two children, Lily Rose and Jack, mean to him.  Lily Rose had E-Coli in 2007 and made it through, as Johnny also mentions in his Rhonda's Kiss acceptance speech.

Johnny Depp Talking About His Kids!

Thank you ALL again, for standing up for pure, unconditional Love--and Innocence!

comment: I survived life threatening domestic violence and amber heard seemed to be looking to get paid women like that make it harder for the real victims. Peace Johnny next time get an iron clad prenup and find a nicer girl will ya?

It's a terrible, distasteful slur on humanity that feminism has become so dogmatic that anyone who looked closely at both sides of Amber Heard's story were mocked, shunned, and many times cyberbullied in horrible ways.  Lily Rose Depp endured many horrible words on one of her posts on Instagram.  One highly emotional and angry woman actually stated that Lily Rose should never have been born!  A woman, angry about another woman's alleged, but not PROVEN, abuse, shot back by emotionally abusing ANOTHER woman--a young one at that!  This hypocrisy is the result of leaning too much on emotion and personal experience, rather than facts.    Amber Heard has an arrest record of Domestic Violence--Johnny Depp doesn't even have a history of it.  Johnny Depp has a history of hitting furniture, throwing bottles, whatnot, trashing hotel rooms, but those things are inanimate objects.  He never once hit a woman in the history of his career or we would have heard about it, and he would have owned up and gone for help.  I forgot one more telltale sign. Why did Johnny Depp refuse Amber instant spousal support if he physically abused her the whole time they were together? He'd have given half his fortune in a heartbeat if any of her claims had been true. 

As hard as it is for many to accept, being that she's a woman, the truth is that Amber Heard has insulted the cause of Stopping Domestic Violence Against Women.  She did so by accusing an innocent man of hurting her physically, when it's crystal clear Johnny Depp did no such thing.  The signs are all there.  Heard may or may not have done it for money but she certainly did it spitefully--obviously because their relationship was toxic from go.  Amber clearly is a sick, sad person who could benefit from professional help--but she doesn't seem to be seeking any.  However--we cannot let her lies OR her myopic supporters affect Johnny doing his job, when he does it so beautifully!

Johnny Depp had to have gone through intense agony this past summer, although he hid it well with a brave face. It may not be desirable to him to re-open the case and prove Amber Heard a liar, given the stress it would bring about for him and his family. However, let's not forget that Depp was prepared with 23 witnesses for the upcoming trial in August.  

Of course, Amber Heard is a master at what she set out to do to him. She, having lived with and known him for four years, knew how to push Johnny Depp's buttons. It was malicious. Once Amber learned of all the ammunition Johnny had gathered for his defense, she wasted no time putting out that video of Johnny cursing and banging around inanimate objects while drunk. She denied putting the video out, but that was just a cover up. No one who saw that video didn't cringe when they saw Johnny Depp really angry--for real, not playing a character. Those who supported Amber took that video and assumed the worst. However, they failed to notice many things.  For one, the camera filming the video was BEHIND Amber Heard, not held in her hand. Why else would we see her? What we hear at the end of the video which may sound like a scuffle and perhaps Amber being thrown to the floor--is actually Johnny ripping the hidden camera out of the wall. What else would it be? He gestures to Amber's hand holding the remote to the camera. But he did not grab the remote. He went right for the camera.  Also, Johnny believed he was by himself before Amber showed up, asking "What happened?" and so on.  Angry as Johnny was, he never verbally abused or degraded Heard, calling her horrific names and slandering her character. His only action was to reach for the remote control in her hand...and then make a bee line for the camera to dismantle it. 

The final straw for Depp was the picture of the severed finger, and the message he "supposedly" wrote on a mirror that indicated Amber Heard had been unfaithful to Johnny with Billy Bob Thornton.

NOBODY took into consideration that despite the report of "Johnny's dipping his gushing finger in paint"...that mirror would be spattered with blood and the message would never have been legible. Why didn't anyone consider that?

Whoever painted that horrible message about Amber Heard and Billy Bob Thornton on that mirror--was not someone with a severed finger gushing blood.  Johnny Depp never painted that message.  That is clear evidence that again, was overlooked by supporters of Amber Heard.

The horrific anguish which I have been through myself, that women have suffered in domestically violent relationships with men, again, caused emotions to run high when Depp was accused. Emotions alone and not sense ruled those supporting Amber in the social media trial. As emotional as I got, however,I also made sure to look carefully at all the clear evidence on both sides. Once I learned what was really going on, I, yes, joined the fray and went to town on social media.  I defended Johnny like a raging lion and still do.  But we will not bring Johnny Depp peace by fighting and mud-slinging with each other.

We need to show support and promote awareness of Domestic Violence against ALL humans. We need to NOT lessen the importance of stopping REAL Abuse Against Women--but we can't forget that all men are not perpetrators and misogynists. Johnny Depp isn't just one more "white male celebrity who can get away with hitting his wife and still work." This is not about that. Johnny Depp is INNOCENT. Mel Gibson and other male celebrities who were proven guilty, yes, may not have much trouble getting work. It's a sad state of affairs, yes, and I am not denying that sexism and misogyny are alive and well in Hollywood. However?  Once all aspects are studied carefully and looked at with at least one foot in logic, not emotion, we CAN see that Johnny Depp was framed.  That said?  We cannot afford to allow Depp to be lumped in with those who actually DID hurt their girlfriends/wives.  That does not help women who suffer violence in the home, any more than allowing these other GUILTY celebrities to continue to work in Hollywood does.

Let's stand strong against violence, lies, bullying and ALL forms of abuse! Let's remember that not ALL celebrity men are conceited misogynists who don't care about anybody but themselves. Johnny Depp has always been real, upfront and has always spoken his Truth. Everyone who meets him or watches an interview with him knows how GENUINELY kind and good he truly is. It's not an act. No one who works with Johnny doesn't know that, no one who loves him doesn't know that.  

Stereotypes, Blindsidedness, bias towards ONE gender who gets domestically violated, stops here.  The unfairly boycotted "Alice: Through the Looking Glass" has a powerful message about how we handle time. Time gives before it takes. Let's use Time as a gift to help end blind fear, needless boycotting, bullying and hate!  LOVE is what keeps Johnny Depp going, as the video above relays.   Johnny was also honored with the Healing and Hope award by Rhonda's Kiss  for his work to find a cure for cancer.  His beloved mother, Betty Sue, died of cancer on May 20th. Here also is a video montage of Johnny discussing what his two children, Lily Rose and Jack, mean to him.  Lily Rose had E-Coli in 2007 and made it through, as Johnny also mentions in his Rhonda's Kiss acceptance speech.

Johnny Depp Talking About His Kids!

Thank you ALL again, for standing up for pure, unconditional Love--and Innocence!

commentable_entity.ask: Support Fantastic Beasts--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.title: Kate Quinn:  Support JK Rowling's Fantastic Beasts Sequel--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.description:
Johnny Depp was accused of something he did not do. He may not have done any prison time, but he may as well be a prisoner of the label inflicted upon him. "Domestic Abuser," is what blindsided Harry Potter fans on Twitter called him as soon as they learned Depp was cast in the saga of JK Rowling's "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them."  Those outraged by the idea of Johnny Depp having anything to do with Harry Potter, a story that promotes anti-bullying and awareness of domestic violence towards children, etc...they NEED to know that this man is INNOCENT. Johnny Depp knew, like so many others, that the West Memphis Three were innocent. He campaigned passionately for them along with Patti Smith, Eddie Vedder and others. However, even after all was said and done, the Three were released from prison, ONLY if they pleaded guilty to murders they never committed! Now, they will wear that stigma on their characters for years, unless they can somehow re-open the case and prove themselves innocent.

Amber Heard was arrested for hitting Tasya Van Ree in 2009, and even if Tasya, obviously still a victim in denial, declared homophobia to be the reason for the arrest?  Beverly Ellis, the very officer who made the arrest, revealed herself and shot back at Tasya's claims.  Ellis is an openly gay woman.  

Domestic Violence against women is too strong an issue to just blindly look at the surface and run on emotions alone. There are many facets to Domestic Violence.  Women are not the only victims of it.  Children, obviously, and even men, are often victims as well.  How many obvious signs that Amber Heard lied about her husband's "violence" were ignored?  Probably more signs than there are letters in the alphabet.  The four that stand out in my mind, however, are as follows:

  1. Those people who SAW, with their own eyes that Amber was NOT bruised the night of, and after May 21st, i.e. Johnny's bodyguards and the concierge at the L.A. Condominium.
  2. The picture of a perfectly bruise-free Amber on Instagram, taken that very next day, Sunday, May 22nd that was suddenly, mysteriously deleted before the abuse claims became headline news.
  3. Vanessa Paradis, a MOM, supposedly dumped by Depp FOR Heard, supporting the father of her kids.  What mom in her right mind would not have had full custody of those two teens had Johnny indeed been beating Amber all through their relationship?  And don't tell me she wouldn't have known...Johnny stays close with his family, and that includes the mother of his kids.
  4. Most Important: The LAPD.  The police, especially in L.A. are NOT allowed to turn a blind eye to a woman claiming abuse by her husband.  Even if said woman didn't file a report.  Why was Johnny Depp not arrested?  Simple.  Not only did the police see no evidence of violence or disarray in the room("No evidence of a crime") but they also stated that Amber never mentioned violence.,


It's a terrible, distasteful slur on humanity that feminism has become so dogmatic that anyone who looked closely at both sides of Amber Heard's story were mocked, shunned, and many times cyberbullied in horrible ways.  Lily Rose Depp endured many horrible words on one of her posts on Instagram.  One highly emotional and angry woman actually stated that Lily Rose should never have been born!  A woman, angry about another woman's alleged, but not PROVEN, abuse, shot back by emotionally abusing ANOTHER woman--a young one at that!  This hypocrisy is the result of leaning too much on emotion and personal experience, rather than facts.    Amber Heard has an arrest record of Domestic Violence--Johnny Depp doesn't even have a history of it.  Johnny Depp has a history of hitting furniture, throwing bottles, whatnot, trashing hotel rooms, but those things are inanimate objects.  He never once hit a woman in the history of his career or we would have heard about it, and he would have owned up and gone for help.  I forgot one more telltale sign. Why did Johnny Depp refuse Amber instant spousal support if he physically abused her the whole time they were together? He'd have given half his fortune in a heartbeat if any of her claims had been true. 

As hard as it is for many to accept, being that she's a woman, the truth is that Amber Heard has insulted the cause of Stopping Domestic Violence Against Women.  She did so by accusing an innocent man of hurting her physically, when it's crystal clear Johnny Depp did no such thing.  The signs are all there.  Heard may or may not have done it for money but she certainly did it spitefully--obviously because their relationship was toxic from go.  Amber clearly is a sick, sad person who could benefit from professional help--but she doesn't seem to be seeking any.  However--we cannot let her lies OR her myopic supporters affect Johnny doing his job, when he does it so beautifully!

Johnny Depp had to have gone through intense agony this past summer, although he hid it well with a brave face. It may not be desirable to him to re-open the case and prove Amber Heard a liar, given the stress it would bring about for him and his family. However, let's not forget that Depp was prepared with 23 witnesses for the upcoming trial in August.  

Of course, Amber Heard is a master at what she set out to do to him. She, having lived with and known him for four years, knew how to push Johnny Depp's buttons. It was malicious. Once Amber learned of all the ammunition Johnny had gathered for his defense, she wasted no time putting out that video of Johnny cursing and banging around inanimate objects while drunk. She denied putting the video out, but that was just a cover up. No one who saw that video didn't cringe when they saw Johnny Depp really angry--for real, not playing a character. Those who supported Amber took that video and assumed the worst. However, they failed to notice many things.  For one, the camera filming the video was BEHIND Amber Heard, not held in her hand. Why else would we see her? What we hear at the end of the video which may sound like a scuffle and perhaps Amber being thrown to the floor--is actually Johnny ripping the hidden camera out of the wall. What else would it be? He gestures to Amber's hand holding the remote to the camera. But he did not grab the remote. He went right for the camera.  Also, Johnny believed he was by himself before Amber showed up, asking "What happened?" and so on.  Angry as Johnny was, he never verbally abused or degraded Heard, calling her horrific names and slandering her character. His only action was to reach for the remote control in her hand...and then make a bee line for the camera to dismantle it. 

The final straw for Depp was the picture of the severed finger, and the message he "supposedly" wrote on a mirror that indicated Amber Heard had been unfaithful to Johnny with Billy Bob Thornton.

NOBODY took into consideration that despite the report of "Johnny's dipping his gushing finger in paint"...that mirror would be spattered with blood and the message would never have been legible. Why didn't anyone consider that?

Whoever painted that horrible message about Amber Heard and Billy Bob Thornton on that mirror--was not someone with a severed finger gushing blood.  Johnny Depp never painted that message.  That is clear evidence that again, was overlooked by supporters of Amber Heard.

The horrific anguish which I have been through myself, that women have suffered in domestically violent relationships with men, again, caused emotions to run high when Depp was accused. Emotions alone and not sense ruled those supporting Amber in the social media trial. As emotional as I got, however,I also made sure to look carefully at all the clear evidence on both sides. Once I learned what was really going on, I, yes, joined the fray and went to town on social media.  I defended Johnny like a raging lion and still do.  But we will not bring Johnny Depp peace by fighting and mud-slinging with each other.

We need to show support and promote awareness of Domestic Violence against ALL humans. We need to NOT lessen the importance of stopping REAL Abuse Against Women--but we can't forget that all men are not perpetrators and misogynists. Johnny Depp isn't just one more "white male celebrity who can get away with hitting his wife and still work." This is not about that. Johnny Depp is INNOCENT. Mel Gibson and other male celebrities who were proven guilty, yes, may not have much trouble getting work. It's a sad state of affairs, yes, and I am not denying that sexism and misogyny are alive and well in Hollywood. However?  Once all aspects are studied carefully and looked at with at least one foot in logic, not emotion, we CAN see that Johnny Depp was framed.  That said?  We cannot afford to allow Depp to be lumped in with those who actually DID hurt their girlfriends/wives.  That does not help women who suffer violence in the home, any more than allowing these other GUILTY celebrities to continue to work in Hollywood does.

Let's stand strong against violence, lies, bullying and ALL forms of abuse! Let's remember that not ALL celebrity men are conceited misogynists who don't care about anybody but themselves. Johnny Depp has always been real, upfront and has always spoken his Truth. Everyone who meets him or watches an interview with him knows how GENUINELY kind and good he truly is. It's not an act. No one who works with Johnny doesn't know that, no one who loves him doesn't know that.  

Stereotypes, Blindsidedness, bias towards ONE gender who gets domestically violated, stops here.  The unfairly boycotted "Alice: Through the Looking Glass" has a powerful message about how we handle time. Time gives before it takes. Let's use Time as a gift to help end blind fear, needless boycotting, bullying and hate!  LOVE is what keeps Johnny Depp going, as the video above relays.   Johnny was also honored with the Healing and Hope award by Rhonda's Kiss  for his work to find a cure for cancer.  His beloved mother, Betty Sue, died of cancer on May 20th. Here also is a video montage of Johnny discussing what his two children, Lily Rose and Jack, mean to him.  Lily Rose had E-Coli in 2007 and made it through, as Johnny also mentions in his Rhonda's Kiss acceptance speech.

Johnny Depp Talking About His Kids!

Thank you ALL again, for standing up for pure, unconditional Love--and Innocence!

commentable_entity.ask: Support Fantastic Beasts--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.title: Kate Quinn:  Support JK Rowling's Fantastic Beasts Sequel--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.description:
Johnny Depp was accused of something he did not do. He may not have done any prison time, but he may as well be a prisoner of the label inflicted upon him. "Domestic Abuser," is what blindsided Harry Potter fans on Twitter called him as soon as they learned Depp was cast in the saga of JK Rowling's "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them."  Those outraged by the idea of Johnny Depp having anything to do with Harry Potter, a story that promotes anti-bullying and awareness of domestic violence towards children, etc...they NEED to know that this man is INNOCENT. Johnny Depp knew, like so many others, that the West Memphis Three were innocent. He campaigned passionately for them along with Patti Smith, Eddie Vedder and others. However, even after all was said and done, the Three were released from prison, ONLY if they pleaded guilty to murders they never committed! Now, they will wear that stigma on their characters for years, unless they can somehow re-open the case and prove themselves innocent.

Amber Heard was arrested for hitting Tasya Van Ree in 2009, and even if Tasya, obviously still a victim in denial, declared homophobia to be the reason for the arrest?  Beverly Ellis, the very officer who made the arrest, revealed herself and shot back at Tasya's claims.  Ellis is an openly gay woman.  

Domestic Violence against women is too strong an issue to just blindly look at the surface and run on emotions alone. There are many facets to Domestic Violence.  Women are not the only victims of it.  Children, obviously, and even men, are often victims as well.  How many obvious signs that Amber Heard lied about her husband's "violence" were ignored?  Probably more signs than there are letters in the alphabet.  The four that stand out in my mind, however, are as follows:

  1. Those people who SAW, with their own eyes that Amber was NOT bruised the night of, and after May 21st, i.e. Johnny's bodyguards and the concierge at the L.A. Condominium.
  2. The picture of a perfectly bruise-free Amber on Instagram, taken that very next day, Sunday, May 22nd that was suddenly, mysteriously deleted before the abuse claims became headline news.
  3. Vanessa Paradis, a MOM, supposedly dumped by Depp FOR Heard, supporting the father of her kids.  What mom in her right mind would not have had full custody of those two teens had Johnny indeed been beating Amber all through their relationship?  And don't tell me she wouldn't have known...Johnny stays close with his family, and that includes the mother of his kids.
  4. Most Important: The LAPD.  The police, especially in L.A. are NOT allowed to turn a blind eye to a woman claiming abuse by her husband.  Even if said woman didn't file a report.  Why was Johnny Depp not arrested?  Simple.  Not only did the police see no evidence of violence or disarray in the room("No evidence of a crime") but they also stated that Amber never mentioned violence.,


It's a terrible, distasteful slur on humanity that feminism has become so dogmatic that anyone who looked closely at both sides of Amber Heard's story were mocked, shunned, and many times cyberbullied in horrible ways.  Lily Rose Depp endured many horrible words on one of her posts on Instagram.  One highly emotional and angry woman actually stated that Lily Rose should never have been born!  A woman, angry about another woman's alleged, but not PROVEN, abuse, shot back by emotionally abusing ANOTHER woman--a young one at that!  This hypocrisy is the result of leaning too much on emotion and personal experience, rather than facts.    Amber Heard has an arrest record of Domestic Violence--Johnny Depp doesn't even have a history of it.  Johnny Depp has a history of hitting furniture, throwing bottles, whatnot, trashing hotel rooms, but those things are inanimate objects.  He never once hit a woman in the history of his career or we would have heard about it, and he would have owned up and gone for help.  I forgot one more telltale sign. Why did Johnny Depp refuse Amber instant spousal support if he physically abused her the whole time they were together? He'd have given half his fortune in a heartbeat if any of her claims had been true. 

As hard as it is for many to accept, being that she's a woman, the truth is that Amber Heard has insulted the cause of Stopping Domestic Violence Against Women.  She did so by accusing an innocent man of hurting her physically, when it's crystal clear Johnny Depp did no such thing.  The signs are all there.  Heard may or may not have done it for money but she certainly did it spitefully--obviously because their relationship was toxic from go.  Amber clearly is a sick, sad person who could benefit from professional help--but she doesn't seem to be seeking any.  However--we cannot let her lies OR her myopic supporters affect Johnny doing his job, when he does it so beautifully!

Johnny Depp had to have gone through intense agony this past summer, although he hid it well with a brave face. It may not be desirable to him to re-open the case and prove Amber Heard a liar, given the stress it would bring about for him and his family. However, let's not forget that Depp was prepared with 23 witnesses for the upcoming trial in August.  

Of course, Amber Heard is a master at what she set out to do to him. She, having lived with and known him for four years, knew how to push Johnny Depp's buttons. It was malicious. Once Amber learned of all the ammunition Johnny had gathered for his defense, she wasted no time putting out that video of Johnny cursing and banging around inanimate objects while drunk. She denied putting the video out, but that was just a cover up. No one who saw that video didn't cringe when they saw Johnny Depp really angry--for real, not playing a character. Those who supported Amber took that video and assumed the worst. However, they failed to notice many things.  For one, the camera filming the video was BEHIND Amber Heard, not held in her hand. Why else would we see her? What we hear at the end of the video which may sound like a scuffle and perhaps Amber being thrown to the floor--is actually Johnny ripping the hidden camera out of the wall. What else would it be? He gestures to Amber's hand holding the remote to the camera. But he did not grab the remote. He went right for the camera.  Also, Johnny believed he was by himself before Amber showed up, asking "What happened?" and so on.  Angry as Johnny was, he never verbally abused or degraded Heard, calling her horrific names and slandering her character. His only action was to reach for the remote control in her hand...and then make a bee line for the camera to dismantle it. 

The final straw for Depp was the picture of the severed finger, and the message he "supposedly" wrote on a mirror that indicated Amber Heard had been unfaithful to Johnny with Billy Bob Thornton.

NOBODY took into consideration that despite the report of "Johnny's dipping his gushing finger in paint"...that mirror would be spattered with blood and the message would never have been legible. Why didn't anyone consider that?

Whoever painted that horrible message about Amber Heard and Billy Bob Thornton on that mirror--was not someone with a severed finger gushing blood.  Johnny Depp never painted that message.  That is clear evidence that again, was overlooked by supporters of Amber Heard.

The horrific anguish which I have been through myself, that women have suffered in domestically violent relationships with men, again, caused emotions to run high when Depp was accused. Emotions alone and not sense ruled those supporting Amber in the social media trial. As emotional as I got, however,I also made sure to look carefully at all the clear evidence on both sides. Once I learned what was really going on, I, yes, joined the fray and went to town on social media.  I defended Johnny like a raging lion and still do.  But we will not bring Johnny Depp peace by fighting and mud-slinging with each other.

We need to show support and promote awareness of Domestic Violence against ALL humans. We need to NOT lessen the importance of stopping REAL Abuse Against Women--but we can't forget that all men are not perpetrators and misogynists. Johnny Depp isn't just one more "white male celebrity who can get away with hitting his wife and still work." This is not about that. Johnny Depp is INNOCENT. Mel Gibson and other male celebrities who were proven guilty, yes, may not have much trouble getting work. It's a sad state of affairs, yes, and I am not denying that sexism and misogyny are alive and well in Hollywood. However?  Once all aspects are studied carefully and looked at with at least one foot in logic, not emotion, we CAN see that Johnny Depp was framed.  That said?  We cannot afford to allow Depp to be lumped in with those who actually DID hurt their girlfriends/wives.  That does not help women who suffer violence in the home, any more than allowing these other GUILTY celebrities to continue to work in Hollywood does.

Let's stand strong against violence, lies, bullying and ALL forms of abuse! Let's remember that not ALL celebrity men are conceited misogynists who don't care about anybody but themselves. Johnny Depp has always been real, upfront and has always spoken his Truth. Everyone who meets him or watches an interview with him knows how GENUINELY kind and good he truly is. It's not an act. No one who works with Johnny doesn't know that, no one who loves him doesn't know that.  

Stereotypes, Blindsidedness, bias towards ONE gender who gets domestically violated, stops here.  The unfairly boycotted "Alice: Through the Looking Glass" has a powerful message about how we handle time. Time gives before it takes. Let's use Time as a gift to help end blind fear, needless boycotting, bullying and hate!  LOVE is what keeps Johnny Depp going, as the video above relays.   Johnny was also honored with the Healing and Hope award by Rhonda's Kiss  for his work to find a cure for cancer.  His beloved mother, Betty Sue, died of cancer on May 20th. Here also is a video montage of Johnny discussing what his two children, Lily Rose and Jack, mean to him.  Lily Rose had E-Coli in 2007 and made it through, as Johnny also mentions in his Rhonda's Kiss acceptance speech.

Thank you ALL again, for standing up for pure, unconditional Love--and Innocence!

comment: I'm signing this because enough is fucking enough. He was innocent all the long and that bitch Amber Heard has got nothing on him. I'm proud of him for being happy and strong because he had people with him that love him. And what will Amber get in return? No one and nothing for being an evil cunt that she is. And it's because of her,I don't like DC now all because of them sticking by her. So fuck them and fuck her.
commentable_entity.ask: Support Fantastic Beasts--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.title: Kate Quinn:  Support JK Rowling's Fantastic Beasts Sequel--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.description:
Johnny Depp was accused of something he did not do. He may not have done any prison time, but he may as well be a prisoner of the label inflicted upon him. "Domestic Abuser," is what blindsided Harry Potter fans on Twitter called him as soon as they learned Depp was cast in the saga of JK Rowling's "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them."  Those outraged by the idea of Johnny Depp having anything to do with Harry Potter, a story that promotes anti-bullying and awareness of domestic violence towards children, etc...they NEED to know that this man is INNOCENT. Johnny Depp knew, like so many others, that the West Memphis Three were innocent. He campaigned passionately for them along with Patti Smith, Eddie Vedder and others. However, even after all was said and done, the Three were released from prison, ONLY if they pleaded guilty to murders they never committed! Now, they will wear that stigma on their characters for years, unless they can somehow re-open the case and prove themselves innocent.

Amber Heard was arrested for hitting Tasya Van Ree in 2009, and even if Tasya, obviously still a victim in denial, declared homophobia to be the reason for the arrest?  Beverly Ellis, the very officer who made the arrest, revealed herself and shot back at Tasya's claims.  Ellis is an openly gay woman.  

Domestic Violence against women is too strong an issue to just blindly look at the surface and run on emotions alone. There are many facets to Domestic Violence.  Women are not the only victims of it.  Children, obviously, and even men, are often victims as well.  How many obvious signs that Amber Heard lied about her husband's "violence" were ignored?  Probably more signs than there are letters in the alphabet.  The four that stand out in my mind, however, are as follows:

  1. Those people who SAW, with their own eyes that Amber was NOT bruised the night of, and after May 21st, i.e. Johnny's bodyguards and the concierge at the L.A. Condominium.
  2. The picture of a perfectly bruise-free Amber on Instagram, taken that very next day, Sunday, May 22nd that was suddenly, mysteriously deleted before the abuse claims became headline news.
  3. Vanessa Paradis, a MOM, supposedly dumped by Depp FOR Heard, supporting the father of her kids.  What mom in her right mind would not have had full custody of those two teens had Johnny indeed been beating Amber all through their relationship?  And don't tell me she wouldn't have known...Johnny stays close with his family, and that includes the mother of his kids.
  4. Most Important: The LAPD.  The police, especially in L.A. are NOT allowed to turn a blind eye to a woman claiming abuse by her husband.  Even if said woman didn't file a report.  Why was Johnny Depp not arrested?  Simple.  Not only did the police see no evidence of violence or disarray in the room("No evidence of a crime") but they also stated that Amber never mentioned violence.,


It's a terrible, distasteful slur on humanity that feminism has become so dogmatic that anyone who looked closely at both sides of Amber Heard's story were mocked, shunned, and many times cyberbullied in horrible ways.  Lily Rose Depp endured many horrible words on one of her posts on Instagram.  One highly emotional and angry woman actually stated that Lily Rose should never have been born!  A woman, angry about another woman's alleged, but not PROVEN, abuse, shot back by emotionally abusing ANOTHER woman--a young one at that!  This hypocrisy is the result of leaning too much on emotion and personal experience, rather than facts.    Amber Heard has an arrest record of Domestic Violence--Johnny Depp doesn't even have a history of it.  Johnny Depp has a history of hitting furniture, throwing bottles, whatnot, trashing hotel rooms, but those things are inanimate objects.  He never once hit a woman in the history of his career or we would have heard about it, and he would have owned up and gone for help.  I forgot one more telltale sign. Why did Johnny Depp refuse Amber instant spousal support if he physically abused her the whole time they were together? He'd have given half his fortune in a heartbeat if any of her claims had been true. 

As hard as it is for many to accept, being that she's a woman, the truth is that Amber Heard has insulted the cause of Stopping Domestic Violence Against Women.  She did so by accusing an innocent man of hurting her physically, when it's crystal clear Johnny Depp did no such thing.  The signs are all there.  Heard may or may not have done it for money but she certainly did it spitefully--obviously because their relationship was toxic from go.  Amber clearly is a sick, sad person who could benefit from professional help--but she doesn't seem to be seeking any.  However--we cannot let her lies OR her myopic supporters affect Johnny doing his job, when he does it so beautifully!

Johnny Depp had to have gone through intense agony this past summer, although he hid it well with a brave face. It may not be desirable to him to re-open the case and prove Amber Heard a liar, given the stress it would bring about for him and his family. However, let's not forget that Depp was prepared with 23 witnesses for the upcoming trial in August.  

Of course, Amber Heard is a master at what she set out to do to him. She, having lived with and known him for four years, knew how to push Johnny Depp's buttons. It was malicious. Once Amber learned of all the ammunition Johnny had gathered for his defense, she wasted no time putting out that video of Johnny cursing and banging around inanimate objects while drunk. She denied putting the video out, but that was just a cover up. No one who saw that video didn't cringe when they saw Johnny Depp really angry--for real, not playing a character. Those who supported Amber took that video and assumed the worst. However, they failed to notice many things.  For one, the camera filming the video was BEHIND Amber Heard, not held in her hand. Why else would we see her? What we hear at the end of the video which may sound like a scuffle and perhaps Amber being thrown to the floor--is actually Johnny ripping the hidden camera out of the wall. What else would it be? He gestures to Amber's hand holding the remote to the camera. But he did not grab the remote. He went right for the camera.  Also, Johnny believed he was by himself before Amber showed up, asking "What happened?" and so on.  Angry as Johnny was, he never verbally abused or degraded Heard, calling her horrific names and slandering her character. His only action was to reach for the remote control in her hand...and then make a bee line for the camera to dismantle it. 

The final straw for Depp was the picture of the severed finger, and the message he "supposedly" wrote on a mirror that indicated Amber Heard had been unfaithful to Johnny with Billy Bob Thornton.

NOBODY took into consideration that despite the report of "Johnny's dipping his gushing finger in paint"...that mirror would be spattered with blood and the message would never have been legible. Why didn't anyone consider that?

Whoever painted that horrible message about Amber Heard and Billy Bob Thornton on that mirror--was not someone with a severed finger gushing blood.  Johnny Depp never painted that message.  That is clear evidence that again, was overlooked by supporters of Amber Heard.

The horrific anguish which I have been through myself, that women have suffered in domestically violent relationships with men, again, caused emotions to run high when Depp was accused. Emotions alone and not sense ruled those supporting Amber in the social media trial. As emotional as I got, however,I also made sure to look carefully at all the clear evidence on both sides. Once I learned what was really going on, I, yes, joined the fray and went to town on social media.  I defended Johnny like a raging lion and still do.  But we will not bring Johnny Depp peace by fighting and mud-slinging with each other.

We need to show support and promote awareness of Domestic Violence against ALL humans. We need to NOT lessen the importance of stopping REAL Abuse Against Women--but we can't forget that all men are not perpetrators and misogynists. Johnny Depp isn't just one more "white male celebrity who can get away with hitting his wife and still work." This is not about that. Johnny Depp is INNOCENT. Mel Gibson and other male celebrities who were proven guilty, yes, may not have much trouble getting work. It's a sad state of affairs, yes, and I am not denying that sexism and misogyny are alive and well in Hollywood. However?  Once all aspects are studied carefully and looked at with at least one foot in logic, not emotion, we CAN see that Johnny Depp was framed.  That said?  We cannot afford to allow Depp to be lumped in with those who actually DID hurt their girlfriends/wives.  That does not help women who suffer violence in the home, any more than allowing these other GUILTY celebrities to continue to work in Hollywood does.

Let's stand strong against violence, lies, bullying and ALL forms of abuse! Let's remember that not ALL celebrity men are conceited misogynists who don't care about anybody but themselves. Johnny Depp has always been real, upfront and has always spoken his Truth. Everyone who meets him or watches an interview with him knows how GENUINELY kind and good he truly is. It's not an act. No one who works with Johnny doesn't know that, no one who loves him doesn't know that.  

Stereotypes, Blindsidedness, bias towards ONE gender who gets domestically violated, stops here.  The unfairly boycotted "Alice: Through the Looking Glass" has a powerful message about how we handle time. Time gives before it takes. Let's use Time as a gift to help end blind fear, needless boycotting, bullying and hate!  LOVE is what keeps Johnny Depp going, as the video above relays.   Johnny was also honored with the Healing and Hope award by Rhonda's Kiss  for his work to find a cure for cancer.  His beloved mother, Betty Sue, died of cancer on May 20th. Here also is a video montage of Johnny discussing what his two children, Lily Rose and Jack, mean to him.  Lily Rose had E-Coli in 2007 and made it through, as Johnny also mentions in his Rhonda's Kiss acceptance speech.

Johnny Depp Talking About His Kids!

Thank you ALL again, for standing up for pure, unconditional Love--and Innocence!

commentable_entity.ask: Support Fantastic Beasts--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.title: Kate Quinn:  Support JK Rowling's Fantastic Beasts Sequel--Remove Ugly Slur Against Johnny Depp!
commentable_entity.description:
Johnny Depp was accused of something he did not do. He may not have done any prison time, but he may as well be a prisoner of the label inflicted upon him. "Domestic Abuser," is what blindsided Harry Potter fans on Twitter called him as soon as they learned Depp was cast in the saga of JK Rowling's "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them."  Those outraged by the idea of Johnny Depp having anything to do with Harry Potter, a story that promotes anti-bullying and awareness of domestic violence towards children, etc...they NEED to know that this man is INNOCENT. Johnny Depp knew, like so many others, that the West Memphis Three were innocent. He campaigned passionately for them along with Patti Smith, Eddie Vedder and others. However, even after all was said and done, the Three were released from prison, ONLY if they pleaded guilty to murders they never committed! Now, they will wear that stigma on their characters for years, unless they can somehow re-open the case and prove themselves innocent.

Amber Heard was arrested for hitting Tasya Van Ree in 2009, and even if Tasya, obviously still a victim in denial, declared homophobia to be the reason for the arrest?  Beverly Ellis, the very officer who made the arrest, revealed herself and shot back at Tasya's claims.  Ellis is an openly gay woman.  

Domestic Violence against women is too strong an issue to just blindly look at the surface and run on emotions alone. There are many facets to Domestic Violence.  Women are not the only victims of it.  Children, obviously, and even men, are often victims as well.  How many obvious signs that Amber Heard lied about her husband's "violence" were ignored?  Probably more signs than there are letters in the alphabet.  The four that stand out in my mind, however, are as follows:

  1. Those people who SAW, with their own eyes that Amber was NOT bruised the night of, and after May 21st, i.e. Johnny's bodyguards and the concierge at the L.A. Condominium.
  2. The picture of a perfectly bruise-free Amber on Instagram, taken that very next day, Sunday, May 22nd that was suddenly, mysteriously deleted before the abuse claims became headline news.
  3. Vanessa Paradis, a MOM, supposedly dumped by Depp FOR Heard, supporting the father of her kids.  What mom in her right mind would not have had full custody of those two teens had Johnny indeed been beating Amber all through their relationship?  And don't tell me she wouldn't have known...Johnny stays close with his family, and that includes the mother of his kids.
  4. Most Important: The LAPD.  The police, especially in L.A. are NOT allowed to turn a blind eye to a woman claiming abuse by her husband.  Even if said woman didn't file a report.  Why was Johnny Depp not arrested?  Simple.  Not only did the police see no evidence of violence or disarray in the room("No evidence of a crime") but they also stated that Amber never mentioned violence.,


It's a terrible, distasteful slur on humanity that feminism has become so dogmatic that anyone who looked closely at both sides of Amber Heard's story were mocked, shunned, and many times cyberbullied in horrible ways.  Lily Rose Depp endured many horrible words on one of her posts on Instagram.  One highly emotional and angry woman actually stated that Lily Rose should never have been born!  A woman, angry about another woman's alleged, but not PROVEN, abuse, shot back by emotionally abusing ANOTHER woman--a young one at that!  This hypocrisy is the result of leaning too much on emotion and personal experience, rather than facts.    Amber Heard has an arrest record of Domestic Violence--Johnny Depp doesn't even have a history of it.  Johnny Depp has a history of hitting furniture, throwing bottles, whatnot, trashing hotel rooms, but those things are inanimate objects.  He never once hit a woman in the history of his career or we would have heard about it, and he would have owned up and gone for help.  I forgot one more telltale sign. Why did Johnny Depp refuse Amber instant spousal support if he physically abused her the whole time they were together? He'd have given half his fortune in a heartbeat if any of her claims had been true. 

As hard as it is for many to accept, being that she's a woman, the truth is that Amber Heard has insulted the cause of Stopping Domestic Violence Against Women.  She did so by accusing an innocent man of hurting her physically, when it's crystal clear Johnny Depp did no such thing.  The signs are all there.  Heard may or may not have done it for money but she certainly did it spitefully--obviously because their relationship was toxic from go.  Amber clearly is a sick, sad person who could benefit from professional help--but she doesn't seem to be seeking any.  However--we cannot let her lies OR her myopic supporters affect Johnny doing his job, when he does it so beautifully!

Johnny Depp had to have gone through intense agony this past summer, although he hid it well with a brave face. It may not be desirable to him to re-open the case and prove Amber Heard a liar, given the stress it would bring about for him and his family. However, let's not forget that Depp was prepared with 23 witnesses for the upcoming trial in August.  

Of course, Amber Heard is a master at what she set out to do to him. She, having lived with and known him for four years, knew how to push Johnny Depp's buttons. It was malicious. Once Amber learned of all the ammunition Johnny had gathered for his defense, she wasted no time putting out that video of Johnny cursing and banging around inanimate objects while drunk. She denied putting the video out, but that was just a cover up. No one who saw that video didn't cringe when they saw Johnny Depp really angry--for real, not playing a character. Those who supported Amber took that video and assumed the worst. However, they failed to notice many things.  For one, the camera filming the video was BEHIND Amber Heard, not held in her hand. Why else would we see her? What we hear at the end of the video which may sound like a scuffle and perhaps Amber being thrown to the floor--is actually Johnny ripping the hidden camera out of the wall. What else would it be? He gestures to Amber's hand holding the remote to the camera. But he did not grab the remote. He went right for the camera.  Also, Johnny believed he was by himself before Amber showed up, asking "What happened?" and so on.  Angry as Johnny was, he never verbally abused or degraded Heard, calling her horrific names and slandering her character. His only action was to reach for the remote control in her hand...and then make a bee line for the camera to dismantle it. 

The final straw for Depp was the picture of the severed finger, and the message he "supposedly" wrote on a mirror that indicated Amber Heard had been unfaithful to Johnny with Billy Bob Thornton.

NOBODY took into consideration that despite the report of "Johnny's dipping his gushing finger in paint"...that mirror would be spattered with blood and the message would never have been legible. Why didn't anyone consider that?

Whoever painted that horrible message about Amber Heard and Billy Bob Thornton on that mirror--was not someone with a severed finger gushing blood.  Johnny Depp never painted that message.  That is clear evidence that again, was overlooked by supporters of Amber Heard.

The horrific anguish which I have been through myself, that women have suffered in domestically violent relationships with men, again, caused emotions to run high when Depp was accused. Emotions alone and not sense ruled those supporting Amber in the social media trial. As emotional as I got, however,I also made sure to look carefully at all the clear evidence on both sides. Once I learned what was really going on, I, yes, joined the fray and went to town on social media.  I defended Johnny like a raging lion and still do.  But we will not bring Johnny Depp peace by fighting and mud-slinging with each other.

We need to show support and promote awareness of Domestic Violence against ALL humans. We need to NOT lessen the importance of stopping REAL Abuse Against Women--but we can't forget that all men are not perpetrators and misogynists. Johnny Depp isn't just one more "white male celebrity who can get away with hitting his wife and still work." This is not about that. Johnny Depp is INNOCENT. Mel Gibson and other male celebrities who were proven guilty, yes, may not have much trouble getting work. It's a sad state of affairs, yes, and I am not denying that sexism and misogyny are alive and well in Hollywood. However?  Once all aspects are studied carefully and looked at with at least one foot in logic, not emotion, we CAN see that Johnny Depp was framed.  That said?  We cannot afford to allow Depp to be lumped in with those who actually DID hurt their girlfriends/wives.  That does not help women who suffer violence in the home, any more than allowing these other GUILTY celebrities to continue to work in Hollywood does.

Let's stand strong against violence, lies, bullying and ALL forms of abuse! Let's remember that not ALL celebrity men are conceited misogynists who don't care about anybody but themselves. Johnny Depp has always been real, upfront and has always spoken his Truth. Everyone who meets him or watches an interview with him knows how GENUINELY kind and good he truly is. It's not an act. No one who works with Johnny doesn't know that, no one who loves him doesn't know that.  

Stereotypes, Blindsidedness, bias towards ONE gender who gets domestically violated, stops here.  The unfairly boycotted "Alice: Through the Looking Glass" has a powerful message about how we handle time. Time gives before it takes. Let's use Time as a gift to help end blind fear, needless boycotting, bullying and hate!  LOVE is what keeps Johnny Depp going, as the video above relays.   Johnny was also honored with the Healing and Hope award by Rhonda's Kiss  for his work to find a cure for cancer.  His beloved mother, Betty Sue, died of cancer on May 20th. Here also is a video montage of Johnny discussing what his two children, Lily Rose and Jack, mean to him.  Lily Rose had E-Coli in 2007 and made it through, as Johnny also mentions in his Rhonda's Kiss acceptance speech.

Johnny Depp Talking About His Kids!

Thank you ALL again, for standing up for pure, unconditional Love--and Innocence!
